intro: Struthanthus domingensis, commonly known as the Dominican morning glory, is a flowering plant native to the Caribbean island of Hispaniola. It is a member of the Convolvulaceae family, characterized by its climbing or trailing growth habit. The plant produces showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that are typically pink or purple in color, blooming in the morning. It thrives in sunny, well-drained soils and is often found in coastal areas and disturbed habitats. Due to its ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in gardens, though it can be invasive in certain environments.
